original_data.question: A 40-year-old man presents to the clinic with complaints of increased bilateral pain in his knees. The pain developed over time and now limits his mobility. He states that the pain is worse at the end of the day, though he does have some early-morning stiffness lasting about 20 minutes. He used to have some success with over-the-counter NSAIDs; however, they no longer help. The patient also has been taking metformin for the past 2 years and is severely obese, with a BMI of 41 kg/m2. Additionally, he states that he has felt increasingly tired during the day, often dozes off during work, and no longer feels refreshed when he wakes up in the morning. Upon examination, there is no tenderness on palpation or erythema; however, some crepitus is felt. He has no other complaints but has a family history of rheumatoid arthritis (RA) on his mother’s side. Which of the following factors is the underlying cause of the patient’s pain, as well as the rest of his complaints?

model_response:
The patient’s symptoms are suggestive of osteoarthritis (OA), which is the most common form of arthritis. The pain typically worsens with activity and improves with rest. Morning stiffness may be present, but it usually lasts less than 1 hour. The pain can be relieved by rest or NSAIDs. The risk factors for OA include obesity, repetitive use of joints (e.g., kneeling for long periods of time or climbing stairs), and previous injury or abnormal joint development. The patient’s family history of RA does not increase his risk for OA. The crepitus felt on examination is a common finding in OA. The patient’s symptoms of fatigue and poor sleep quality are likely due to his obesity. Metformin is not known to cause any of the symptoms described.

Answer: OPTION B IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: Human males as cultural, psychological, sociological, political, and economic entities.
Those facilities which administer health services to individuals who do not require hospitalization or institutionalization.
A symptom or problem for which a patient seeks medical attention.
Affecting both sides of the body or a matched pair of organs.
A region of the lower extremity immediately surrounding and including the KNEE JOINT.
An unpleasant sensation induced by noxious stimuli which are detected by NERVE ENDINGS of NOCICEPTIVE NEURONS.
The dimension of the physical universe which, at a given place, orders the sequence of events. (McGraw-Hill Dictionary of Scientific and Technical Terms, 6th ed)
Restricted or in amount, size, or extent.

The distance and direction to which a bone joint can be extended. Range of motion is a function of the condition of the joints, muscles, and connective tissues involved. Joint flexibility can be improved through appropriate MUSCLE STRETCHING EXERCISES.
A constituent administrative district of a nation.
An unpleasant sensation induced by noxious stimuli which are detected by NERVE ENDINGS of NOCICEPTIVE NEURONS.
Occurring or done each day.
A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.
An event that accomplishes its intended purpose.

Anti-inflammatory agents that are non-steroidal in nature. In addition to anti-inflammatory actions, they have analgesic, antipyretic, and platelet-inhibitory actions. They act by blocking the synthesis of prostaglandins by inhibiting cyclooxygenase, which converts arachidonic acid to cyclic endoperoxides, precursors of prostaglandins. Inhibition of prostaglandin synthesis accounts for their analgesic, antipyretic, and platelet-inhibitory actions; other mechanisms may contribute to their anti-inflammatory effects.
Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.

A status with BODY WEIGHT that is grossly above the recommended standards, usually due to accumulation of excess FATS in the body. The standards may vary with age, sex, genetic or cultural background. In the BODY MASS INDEX, a BMI greater than 30.0 kg/m2 is considered obese, and a BMI greater than 40.0 kg/m2 is considered morbidly obese (MORBID OBESITY).
A constituent administrative district of a nation.
An abnormally high blood pH (usually defined as 7.41 or above). [PMID:24381489]
The state of weariness following a period of exertion, mental or physical, characterized by a decreased capacity for work and reduced efficiency to respond to stimuli.
Occurring or done each day.
Productive or purposeful activities.
The time period between dawn and noon.
Systematic and thorough inspection of the patient for physical signs of disease or abnormality.
A dull achy pain.
Application of fingers with light pressure to the surface of the body to determine consistence of parts beneath in physical diagnosis; includes palpation for determining the outlines of organs.
Redness of the skin produced by congestion of the capillaries. This condition may result from a variety of disease processes.
Air trapped in the subcutaneous space. It can be palpated or heard as a crackling or grating sensation under the skin.
A symptom or problem for which a patient seeks medical attention.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and disease events of blood relatives. A patient's family medical history may be important in diagnosing existing conditions.

A chronic systemic disease, primarily of the joints, marked by inflammatory changes in the synovial membranes and articular structures, widespread fibrinoid degeneration of the collagen fibers in mesenchymal tissues, and by atrophy and rarefaction of bony structures. Etiology is unknown, but autoimmune mechanisms have been implicated.

A chronic systemic disease, primarily of the joints, marked by inflammatory changes in the synovial membranes and articular structures, widespread fibrinoid degeneration of the collagen fibers in mesenchymal tissues, and by atrophy and rarefaction of bony structures. Etiology is unknown, but autoimmune mechanisms have been implicated.
Female parents, human or animal.
A line segment forming part of the perimeter of a plane figure.
Plasmids encoding COLICINS.
Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.
A symptom or problem for which a patient seeks medical attention.
